Bee Data module

class BeeData.BeeData(acoustic_folder='data/SplitData/', logname='BeeData.log', bee_col='label', file_name='beeAnnotations_enhanced.csv', annotation_file='beeAnnotations.mlf', start_col_name='start', end_col_name='end', file_col_name='file name', duration_col_name='duration', key_col_name='index')[source]

Bases: object

Class to conduct data manipulation on audio files.

Parameters:

  • annotation_file (str) – name of the .mlf file to be read

  • start_col_name (str) – name of the column with the start time

  • end_col_name (str) – name of the column with the end time

  • label_col_name (str) – name of the column with the bee/nobee label

  • file_col_name (str) – name of the column with the file name

  • duration_col_name (str) – column name for the duration

annotation_data_creation(special_action_column=True, dict_actions={'active day': ['active - day'], 'missing queen': ['missing queen', 'no_queen'], 'swarming': ['swarming']})[source]

Function to create the dataset for annotation and save it locally under the specified file name.

Parameters:

  • special_action_column (bool) – boolean which indicates if the special action column will be calculated

  • dict_actions (dict) – dictionary with the new column names as the key and the string match to be searched.Note that each string should be in a list

Returns:

pandas.DataFrame containing the filename, start time, end time, duration between both, bee/nobee label and action columns. The data is stores in the object.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

calc_duration(df)[source]

Calculates the duration between two time periods

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – The dataframe to calculate duration in

Returns:

pd.Series containing the duration

Return type:

pandas.Series

create_actions(df, dict_actions)[source]

Creates new columns with labels based on the provided dictionary

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – The dataframe to calculate duration in

  • dict_actions (dict) – dictionary with the new column names as the key and the string match to be searched.Note that each string should be in a list

Returns:

data frame with the new columns

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

create_validate_data(sliced=True, file_name='annotation_data_type.csv')[source]

Creates validation data set for the data types.

Parameters:

  • sliced (bool) – boolean to indicate whether to create validation based on the sliced data or not

  • file_name (basestring) – name of the file to be saved to

Returns:

csv file with the validation data

data_quality(nobee=False, path='data', min_duration=2.0)[source]

Ensures quality data

Parameters:

  • path (str) – directory path for the wav and mp3 files

  • min_duration (float) – minimum duration of the file segment in order to make sense to work with it

Returns:

data frame with data quality annotation_df_quality, stored in the object

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

mlf_data_read()[source]

Read a file with .mlf extension. The file is expected to have the following format: - acoustic file name to be on a new row - each column entry to be separated by a tab - each tow to end with a new row sign - columns - start, end (in min and seconds format) and label -bee and nobee

Returns:

a pandas dataframe

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

split_acoustic_data_sliced()[source]

Splits the original files based on the annotation data sliced and saves it in the folder

Returns:

wav files

time_slice(nobee=False, step=2000, start_sliced_col_name='start_sliced', end_sliced_col_name='end_sliced')[source]

Function to split the annotation data into smaller segments based on the step size

Parameters:

  • nobee (bool) – Boolean value to indicate if nobee files to be added in the data set. True means nobee files are included.

  • step (float) – time step in miliseconds

  • start_sliced_col_name (str) – name of the column for the start sliced

  • end_sliced_col_name (str) – name of the column for the end sliced

Returns:

pd.DataFrame with an annotation data which is sliced, stored in self.annotation_df_sliced

Return type:

pd.DataFrame
